summary: This document is a chain of emails from October 2020 between FBI personnel and a U.S. Attorney's Office (likely SDNY) regarding the technical review and transfer of media files (audio/video) from the Jeffrey Epstein investigation file (316-MM-108062). It discusses issues with accessing some grand jury testimony audio files from 2006 and confirms the receipt and review of materials obtained via FOIA.

persons.name: AUSA Moe
persons.context: Primary email recipient from the FBI; appears to be the prosecutor coordinating the review of Epstein investigation materials for discovery.

connections.description: Communicating about the technical review and transfer of Epstein investigation media files for discovery purposes.

events.title: Grand Jury Testimony Audio Files
events.description: 48 audio files of grand jury testimony from the Epstein investigation, received from the Palm Beach State Attorney's Office.

events.title: Interview of [Redacted]
events.description: Audio interview from the Epstein investigation.

events.title: Deposition of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Video deposition of Jeffrey Epstein from the civil case 'Jane Doe vs. Jeffrey Epstein'.

keyFacts: The FBI's FOIA media team downloaded media from Epstein investigation file 316-MM-108062, including audio and video files.
Technical issues prevented listening to 48 grand jury testimony audio files from July 19, 2006, due to a 'codes problem' likely from an export error by the AUSA's office.
The media included a 2010 video deposition of Jeffrey Epstein from the civil case 'Jane Doe vs. Jeffrey Epstein'.
Email correspondence indicates ongoing coordination in 2020 between the FBI and SDNY to ensure complete discovery materials from the Epstein case were reviewed and produced.
